tweet:
Happy to cosponsor @SenCoryGardner's  bill to expand training track programs to encourage more doctors to perform their residencies in rural areas. This could have long-term benefits for rural MS & America.

 https://www.hydesmith.senate.gov/content/hyde-smith-cosponsors-bill-encourage-doctors-practice-rural-america …

Thank you @SenJoniErnst for your leadership. I’m happy to cosponsor this bill. It shouldn't take a law to emphasize the protection of our citizens is a priority for any federal agency, especially in cases of illegal immigrants committing serious crimes. https://twitter.com/SenJoniErnst/status/1091021519197745158 …

Enjoyed my conversation with @PYNance of @CWforA.  We discussed the role of conservative women in the 116th Congress and some of my work in the U.S. Senate. Listen here:  https://concernedwomen.org/use-your-voice/  pic.twitter.com/BeRe7DRUW9

Pleased to cosponsor @SenJohnThune's bill to repeal the "death tax". Directing revenue from tariffs imposed on Chinese products to border security would ensure resources are available to enforce current law. This is a reasonable use of tariff monies and gets us past the argument over who is paying for border barriers and other security upgrades. pic.twitter.com/wdTR30EWMI
HYDE-SMITH PROPOSES USING TARIFF REVENUES TO FUND BORDER BARRIERS ( http://bit.ly/2Mvtvb1 ) pic.twitter.com/t19dv14JtE
Disappointed with failed vote to reopen the government AND secure the border. I’ve introduced a bill that could help us reach a solution. pic.twitter.com/x7UuXgwYo4

The Senate votes today on ending the government shutdown. One vote on a compromise bill the President will sign. Another on a plan he won’t. I’ll vote for the compromise to get 800k people back to work AND secure the border. pic.twitter.com/zKmUxLSvTu

My field staff was on hand for the @FamiliesFirstMS family resource center grand opening in Calhoun City. Thank you Vardaman Mayor James Casey, Bruce Mayor Rudy Pope, Calhoun City Mayor Amye Hill, & the late Pittsboro Mayor Reda Bullard for supporting this good endeavor. pic.twitter.com/WwSKl8XGac

In the nearly 50 years since Roe v Wade, there has been a valiant and ongoing fight to protect innocent lives, and establishing a permanent ban on using taxpayer dollars would be a significant step forward.  https://www.hydesmith.senate.gov/content/hyde-smith-votes-permanent-ban-federal-funding-abortions … pic.twitter.com/7ySyuHnbJY

As a cosponsor of @SenBillCassidy bill to stop states from circumventing the law to offer Medicaid benefits to illegal immigrants, I’m working to protect states, like Mississippi, that follow the law and dedicate Medicaid resources to their citizens. https://thehayride.com/2019/01/sen-cassidy-follows-through-introduces-protect-medicaid-act/ …
Great to be with friends at a @SBAList event tonight.  We're all working for policies that promote life. #prolife pic.twitter.com/Gv5pSQ4iw5

Day 26:  Resolving the shutdown will require good-faith negotiations by the Democrats, who supported border fencing and barriers in the past. @realdonaldtrump wants to accelerate this process to get operational control of the border. I support this goal. pic.twitter.com/lzmOWHVdQt
Pleased to have my Appropriations subcommittee assignments. Look forward to working with Chairman @SenShelby and my colleagues to pass responsible spending bills. pic.twitter.com/xg1fyiN4hm

In celebration of the centennial of the American Farm Bureau Federation, I cosponsored Sen. @JerryMoran's resolution to recognize and applaud the important work the @FarmBureau and @MSFB have done for the agriculture industry in Mississippi and across the nation. pic.twitter.com/5eDR15fwon

It was a great pleasure to have @USArmy Major Paul Bankston working in my office last year as a defense legislative fellow. His insights and dedication to duty and service were a true benefit to Mississippi and our nation. pic.twitter.com/FfONx4jVQV

As a champion for rights of gun owners, I’m proud to again cosponsor @JohnCornyn #concealcarry reciprocity bill.  Read more about it here:  http://bit.ly/2VHUofR

Committee assignments set. Excited to continue important work for Mississippi on the Appropriations and @SenateAgGOP committees. Also look forward to serving as a new member of @EnergyGOP. Read more here:  http://bit.ly/2sjHh75
This #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay we take time to honor the courageous men and women who put their lives on the line daily for our safety and freedom. pic.twitter.com/jBN2o6ZqiK

The defense and protection of the American people is our #1 responsibility. @realdonaldtrump is resolute in his commitment to addressing security on the southern border. Democrats must negotiate in good faith.

My first bill in the 116th Congress is a balanced budget resolution. The American people expect their government to manage their tax dollars responsibly.  Our growing deficit & debt will catch up with us if we don’t act to control spending. Read more here:  http://bit.ly/2sfdufI
I'm so pleased to have Rep. Michael Guest join our state's congressional delegation. We'll be working as part of a strong team for #Mississippi. #116thCongress pic.twitter.com/r54dW3Yuvs

Very pleased to be with @SenatorWicker today as he was sworn in for a new term. Look forward to working with him in the 116th Congress to benefit our great state and nation. pic.twitter.com/lZPkLuoyJS
